{"step_by_step_thinking": "Amyloidosis is a condition characterized by the buildup of abnormal proteins called amyloids in organs and tissues. Hemodialysis-associated amyloidosis specifically refers to the buildup of amyloid proteins in people who have been on long-term hemodialysis. The type of amyloid protein that builds up in this condition is beta-2 microglobulin, which is not effectively removed by standard hemodialysis.", "answer_choice": "C. b- 2 microglobulin"}
